intro: Rhynchospora flexuosa subsp. tepuiana, commonly known as the slender marsh sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green to brown in color. It is characterized by its flexible stems and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Rhynchospora flexuosa subsp. tepuiana plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
